item.title: Trump Speaks on US Stock Market and Jobs
item.description: President Donald Trump spoke at the White House, kicking off 4th off July celebrations. He said the stock market and jobs are at an all-time high and that "we're going to keep it that way." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump Signs His Tax-and-Spend Bill at White House Ceremony
item.description: President Donald Trump signed his $3.4 trillion budget bill into law Friday, enshrining an extension of tax cuts, temporary new breaks for tipped workers and funding to crack down on illegal immigration.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Lai, Jennifer A Dlouhy

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump displays the signed bill during a ceremony for the One Big Beautiful Bill Act on the South Lawn of the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Friday, July 4, 2025. Trump signed his $3.4 trillion budget bill into law Friday, enshrining an extension of tax cuts, temporary new breaks for tipped workers and funding to crack down on illegal immigration.

item.title: Trump Signs 'Big, Beautiful Bill' at July 4th Ceremony
item.description: President Donald Trump signed his $3.4 trillion budget bill into law Friday, enshrining an extension of tax cuts, temporary new breaks for tipped workers and funding to crack down on illegal immigration. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump Kicks off White House July 4th Celebrations
item.description: President Donald Trump speaks to crowd at the White House. commencing the 2025 July 4th celebration. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: OPEC+ Considers Accelerating Oil Production More Than Expected
item.description: OPEC+ is considering accelerating its oil production revival even more rapidly than expected during a virtual meeting on Saturday, delegates said.
item.dc:creator: Nayla Razzouk, Salma El Wardany, Fiona MacDonald, Grant Smith

media:content.media:description: An Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) branded oil drum at the COP29 climate conference in Baku, Azerbaijan, in 2024. Photographer: Andrey Rudakov/Bloomberg

item.title: Canada’s H&R Says It’s in Talks on Potential Sale
item.description: H&R Real Estate Investment Trust, one of Canada’s largest publicly traded real estate companies, is in discussions with multiple parties about a potential transaction that may result in a sale.
item.dc:creator: Ari Altstedter

media:content.media:description: Buildings in downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada, on Wednesday, June 21, 2023. Canada is scheduled to release gross domestic product (GDP) figures on June 30. Photographer: James MacDonald/Bloomberg

item.title: China Can Work With France Across Range of Industries, Wang Says
item.description: China is ready to cooperate with France in industries such as nuclear power, aviation, artificial intelligence, green energy and biotechnology, Foreign Minister Wang Yi said.
item.dc:creator: Samy Adghirni, Li Liu

media:content.media:description: Jean-Noel Barrot, right, and Wang Yi arrive for a news conference in Paris on July 4. Photographer: Aurelien Morissard/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Oil Drops for Second Day as Traders Brace for Another OPEC+ Hike
item.description: Oil fell for a second day in the lead up to an OPEC+ meeting that’s expected to deliver another substantial production hike, while President Donald Trump’s latest tariff threats dented wider risk appetite.
item.dc:creator: Alex Longley, Robert Tuttle

media:content.media:description: The sun rises beyond oil storage tanks at the Enbridge Inc. Cushing storage terminal in Cushing, Oklahoma, U.S., on Wednesday, March 25, 2015. The fastest oil-inventory growth on record at the main U.S. hub may be about to end, easing concern that storage limits will be strained.

item.title: Stock Futures Slide as Tariff Deadline Draws Near: Markets Wrap
item.description: US stock futures retreated Friday as American trade partners pushed for concessions ahead of a July 9 deadline to finalize trade deals with the Trump administration. Meanwhile OPEC+ delegates meeting tomorrow will consider an increase of more than 411,000 barrels a day in August.
item.dc:creator: Andre Janse Van Vuuren, Sagarika Jaisinghani

media:content.media:description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent discusses the possible economic impact of President Donald Trump's "big, beautiful bill," the Treasury's financing needs and the recent decline in the US dollar on Bloomberg Television.

item.title: Spotify Accused by Turkish Official of ‘Insulting’ Content
item.description: A Turkish official called for legal action against Spotify Technologies SA, saying the streaming service’s content isn’t in accord with the nation’s cultural and moral values.
item.dc:creator: Tugce Ozsoy

media:content.media:description: The Spotify logo on a smartphone arranged in Saint Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, on Saturday, Jan. 29, 2022. Spotify Technology SA outlined steps it will take to halt the spread of misleading information about Covid-19 on its audio-streaming service in an attempt to quell a growing controversy over its support for the podcast host Joe Rogan. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: BRICS Set to Condemn ‘Coercive’ Tariffs, Draft Statement Shows
item.description: BRICS leaders are poised to adopt a position at odds with US President Donald Trump on trade tariffs, aspects of conflict in the Middle East and the need to tackle climate change.
item.dc:creator: Mirette Magdy, S'thembile Cele

media:content.media:description: Signage for the BRICS summit 2025 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil on July 4.

item.title: Ex-Janus Henderson Analyst Jailed Over WFH Insider Trades
item.description: A former Janus Henderson Group Plc analyst and his sister were jailed by a London judge on Friday, after being found guilty of laundering money and insider dealing.
item.dc:creator: Lucca De Paoli

media:content.media:description: Redinel Korfuzi, a former analyst at Janus Henderson Group Plc, left, and his sister, Oerta Korfuzi, arrive at Southwark Crown Court in London, UK, on Wednesday, Feb. 19, 2025. Redinel Korfuzi is facing charges of conspiracy to insider trade and handling criminal property along with his sister, Oerta Korfuzi, his personal trainer Rogerio De Aquino and another at a 16 week London trial that started Thursday.

item.title: Quant Hedge Funds Ride Whiplash Markets to First-Half Riches
item.description: From Treasury market reversals to trade threats, the first half of 2025 was dominated by policy upheaval and Wall Street angst. The dollar famously fell, while commodities and risky assets were whipsawed. But inside the markets where the world’s biggest quants operate, a funny thing happened: Time-honored trading patterns prevailed.
item.dc:creator: Justina Lee, Nishant Kumar

item.title: AGF Seeks Stability After CEO’s Death With Goldring Taking Over
item.description: Analysts are mourning the sudden death of Kevin McCreadie, AGF Management Ltd.’s chief executive officer, and praised the asset manager for swiftly enacting its succession plan.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Hughes

media:content.media:description: Kevin McCreadie, chief executive officer of AGF Management Ltd., speaks during an interview in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, on Thursday, March 12, 2020. McCreadie said that small and medium-sized businesses are at particular risk if they're not given enough access to loans in an economy with a cash crunch.

item.title: European Stocks Post Weekly Drop With Focus on US Trade Deals
item.description: European stocks posted a weekly decline on lingering uncertainty around US trade deals ahead of an initial tariff deadline next week.
item.dc:creator: Sagarika Jaisinghani, Indy Scholtens

item.title: AirAsia Seals $12 Billion Airbus Order on State Visit to France
item.description: AirAsia Bhd reached a tentative agreement to purchase as many as 70 extended-range Airbus SE jets as Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim wrapped up his European tour with a deal that could reach $12.3 billion in value.
item.dc:creator: Danny Lee, Kate Duffy

media:content.media:description: An Airbus A320 aircraft operated by AirAsia Group Bhd. grounded at Kuala Lumpur International Airport Airport 2 in Sepang, Selangor, Malaysia, on Tuesday, Nov. 9, 2021. Singapore and Malaysia will allow quarantine-free entry for fully vaccinated travelers flying between Changi Airport and Kuala Lumpur International Airport, one of the world's busiest air routes. Photographer: Samsul Said/Bloomberg

item.title: Hugo Boss Shareholder Frasers Warns It Won’t Back Dividends
item.description: Frasers Group Plc warned Hugo Boss AG it will vote against any dividends, as the British retailer owned by billionaire Mike Ashley exerts its influence after years of building a stake in the German fashion house.
item.dc:creator: Katie Linsell, Lisa Pham, Deirdre Hipwell

media:content.media:description: Mike Ashley Photographer: Chris J. Ratcliffe/Bloomberg

item.title: Jane Street Probe in India to Expand Further, SEBI Official Says
item.description: India’s investigation of alleged manipulative trades by Jane Street Group will expand to include other major stock indexes over the coming months, a Securities and Exchange Board of India official said, without providing a timeline of when the probe will end.
item.dc:creator: Menaka Doshi, Chiranjivi Chakraborty

media:content.media:description: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) headquarters at the Bombay Kurla Complex (BKC) in Mumbai, India, on Wednesday, Oct. 4, 2023. India’s central bank added more firepower to its inflation-busting toolkit as the nation’s entry into global bond index is set to test policymakers’ resolve to manage billions of dollars of inflows that could further fan price pressures. Photographer: Dhiraj Singh/Bloomberg

item.title: UBS, Citi Among Banks Punished in Singapore Laundering Saga
item.description: Singapore imposed S$27.5 million ($21.5 million) in penalties on nine financial firms, including a few of the world’s biggest banks, for lapses related to the city’s largest money laundering case.
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Ng, David Ramli, Chanyaporn Chanjaroen

item.title: US-Swiss Trade Deal Likely to Contain Assurances on Pharma Levy
item.description: The draft of a trade accord between the US and Switzerland contains a provision that the European country will receive preferred treatment in the ongoing national-security investigations to avoid tariffs on pharma exports, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Bastian Benrath-Wright, Jenny Leonard

item.title: Portugal Stocks Recover From 2014 Crisis, Helped by Foreign Cash
item.description: Portuguese stocks hit a 14-year high, finally recovering from losses that followed the biggest bank failure in the country’s modern history.
item.dc:creator: Henrique Almeida

item.title: UK Reaches Deal to Restart Fuel Deliveries From Lindsey Refinery
item.description: The UK has reached a deal that will allow deliveries of fuel to restart from the Lindsey refinery.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Morison

media:content.media:description: The Lindsey oil refinery in North Killingholme, UK.

item.title: BBVA to Go Ahead With Sabadell Bid Despite TSB Sale
item.description: BBVA SA is set to push ahead with its takeover bid for Banco Sabadell SA, even after its rival’s move this week to sell its UK unit, according to people familiar with the mater.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Zuloaga

media:content.media:description: A Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria SA bank branch in Barcelona.

item.title: Unnamed AIA Group Shareholder Is Said to Sell $3.4 Billion Stake
item.description: An undisclosed AIA Group Ltd. shareholder sold a HK$26.8 billion ($3.4 billion) stake in the insurer via block trades, according to people familiar with the matter, in one of the biggest disposals in the city this year.
item.dc:creator: Julia Fioretti, Manuel Baigorri

media:content.media:description: Signage for AIA Group Ltd. on the AIA Central building in Hong Kong. Photographer: Lam Yik/Bloomberg

item.title: China Exempts Major EU Brandy Makers From Anti-Dumping Duty
item.description: China imposed anti-dumping duties on European brandy for five years, while exempting major cognac makers that committed to keeping their prices above minimum levels.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Lulu Shen, Hallie Gu

media:content.media:description: Remy Martin Photographer: Bryan Bedder/Getty Images

item.title: Peru Copper Disruptions Show Rising Clout of Informal Miners
item.description: This week’s copper transport disruptions in Peru underscore the growing impact of informal mining on global corporations that operate in the Andean nation.
item.dc:creator: James Attwood

media:content.media:description: A mining truck travels near the MMG Ltd. Las Bambas copper mine in Apurimac, Peru, on Thursday, Sept. 5, 2024. Peru's massive copper deposits are key to meeting growing global demand but a battle has emerged over who gets to mine and sell them.

item.title: ECB’s Makhlouf Says Inflation Expectations Are Well Anchored
item.description: European Central Bank Governing Council member Gabriel Makhlouf said inflation expectations in the euro area are well anchored and allowed the region to avoid large increases in unemployment during the most recent period of strong consumer-price growth.
item.dc:creator: Bastian Benrath-Wright

media:content.media:description: Gabriel Makhlouf Photographer: Sergio Garcia

item.title: Modi Touts Growth, Bid to Lead Global South Ahead of BRICS
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is using his ongoing tour of five nations across Africa and South America to reaffirm India’s leadership ambitions for the Global South, ahead of a BRICS summit.
item.dc:creator: Swati Gupta, Prateek Mazumdar

item.title: Fintechs Look to Join Saudi Listing Boom Amid Growing Demand
item.description: Two Saudi Arabian fintechs are preparing to list in Riyadh, people familiar with the matter said, looking to tap into growing demand for such services in the kingdom.
item.dc:creator: Laura Gardner Cuesta

media:content.media:description: Riyadh Photographer: Jeremy Suyker/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump’s Tax Package Curbs Renewable Energy Just as AI’s Power Needs Soar
item.description: The bill unplugs more than 300 gigawatts of wind and solar projects that would have been built through 2035, according to one analysis.
item.dc:creator: Brian Eckhouse

media:content.media:description: Transmission lines near an Amazon Web Services data center in Dublin, Ohio, US, on Saturday, March 23, 2024. Amazon.com Inc. plans to spend almost $150 billion in the coming 15 years on data centers, giving the cloud-computing giant the firepower to handle an expected explosion in demand for artificial intelligence applications and other digital services. Photographer: Brian Kaiser/Bloomberg
